storage.name: AccountNonce
documentation: Extrinsics nonce for accounts.

storage.name: ExtrinsicCount
documentation: Total extrinsics count for the current block.

storage.name: AllExtrinsicsWeight
documentation: Total weight for all extrinsics put together, for the current block.

storage.name: BlockHash
documentation: Map of block numbers to block hashes.

storage.name: ExtrinsicData
documentation: Extrinsics data for the current block (maps an extrinsic's index to its data).

storage.name: RandomMaterial
documentation: Series of block headers from the last 81 blocks that acts as random seed material. This is arranged as a
ring buffer with the `i8` prefix being the index into the `Vec` of the oldest hash.

storage.name: Number
documentation: The current block number being processed. Set by `execute_block`.

storage.name: ParentHash
documentation: Hash of the previous block.

storage.name: ExtrinsicsRoot
documentation: Extrinsics root of the current block, also part of the block header.

storage.name: Digest
documentation: Digest of the current block, also part of the block header.

storage.name: Events
documentation: Events deposited for the current block.

storage.name: EventCount
documentation: The number of events in the `Events<T>` list.

storage.name: EventTopics
documentation: Mapping between a topic (represented by T::Hash) and a vector of indexes
of events in the `<Events<T>>` list.
The first key serves no purpose. This field is declared as double_map just
for convenience of using `remove_prefix`.
All topic vectors have deterministic storage locations depending on the topic. This
allows light-clients to leverage the changes trie storage tracking mechanism and
in case of changes fetch the list of events of interest.
The value has the type `(T::BlockNumber, EventIndex)` because if we used only just
the `EventIndex` then in case if the topic has the same contents on the next block
no notification will be triggered thus the event might be lost.

events.name: ExtrinsicSuccess
documentation: An extrinsic completed successfully.

events.name: ExtrinsicFailed
documentation: An extrinsic failed.

storage.name: NextEnumSet
documentation: The next free enumeration set.

storage.name: EnumSet
documentation: The enumeration sets.

events.name: NewAccountIndex
documentation: A new account index was assigned.
This event is not triggered when an existing index is reassigned
to another `AccountId`.

storage.name: Now
documentation: Current time for the current block.

storage.name: BlockPeriod
documentation: Old storage item provided for compatibility. Remove after all networks upgraded.

storage.name: MinimumPeriod
documentation: The minimum period between blocks. Beware that this is different to the *expected* period
that the block production apparatus provides. Your chosen consensus system will generally
work with this to determine a sensible block time. e.g. For Aura, it will be double this
period on default settings.

storage.name: DidUpdate
documentation: Did the timestamp get updated in this block?

calls.name: set
documentation: Set the current time.
This call should be invoked exactly once per block. It will panic at the finalization phase,
if this call hasn't been invoked by that time.
The timestamp should be greater than the previous one by the amount specified by `minimum_period`.
The dispatch origin for this call must be `Inherent`.

calls.name: report_misbehavior
documentation: Report some misbehavior.

calls.name: note_offline
documentation: Note that the previous block's validator missed its opportunity to propose a block.

calls.name: remark
documentation: Make some on-chain remark.

calls.name: set_heap_pages
documentation: Set the number of pages in the WebAssembly environment's heap.

calls.name: set_code
documentation: Set the new code.

calls.name: set_max_extrinsics_count
documentation: Set max extrinsics count for transaction pool.

calls.name: set_storage
documentation: Set some items of storage.

calls.name: kill_storage
documentation: Kill some items from storage.

storage.name: Validators
documentation: The current set of validators.

storage.name: SessionLength
documentation: Current length of the session.

storage.name: CurrentIndex
documentation: Current index of the session.

storage.name: CurrentStart
documentation: Timestamp when current session started.

storage.name: SessionTotalMissedBlocksCount
documentation: Total missed blocks count in the last session.

storage.name: ForcingNewSession
documentation: New session is being forced is this entry exists; in which case, the boolean value is whether
the new session should be considered a normal rotation (rewardable) or exceptional (slashable).

storage.name: LastLengthChange
documentation: Block at which the session length last changed.

storage.name: NextKeyFor
documentation: The next key for a given validator.

storage.name: NextSessionLength
documentation: The next session length.

calls.name: set_length
documentation: Set a new session length. Won't kick in until the next session change (at current length).

calls.name: force_new_session
documentation: Forces a new session.

events.name: NewSession
documentation: New session has happened. Note that the argument is the session index, not the block
number as the type might suggest.

calls.name: final_hint
documentation: Hint that the author of this block thinks the best finalized
block is the given number.

calls.name: set_sessions_per_era
documentation: Set the number of sessions in an grandpa.

calls.name: report_misbehavior
documentation: Report some misbehaviour.

events.name: NewAuthorities
documentation: New authority set has been applied.

storage.name: MethodCallWeight
documentation: Emergency control
Each callable method in runtime normally has a different weight.

storage.name: ProducerFeeProportion
documentation: How much fee of a block should be rewarded to the block producer.

storage.name: TransactionBaseFee
documentation: The fee to be paid for making a transaction; the base.

storage.name: TransactionByteFee
documentation: The fee to be paid for making a transaction; the per-byte portion.

calls.name: modify_switcher
documentation: set open/close for switcher

calls.name: set_method_call_weight
documentation: Set a new weight for a method.

calls.name: remove_method_call_weight
documentation: Remove a method weight.

calls.name: add_blocked_account
documentation: add an account into blocked list

calls.name: remove_blocked_account
documentation: remove an account into blocked list

storage.name: AssetList
documentation: Asset token index list for Chain, different Chain has different token list

storage.name: AssetInfo
documentation: asset info for every token, key is token token

storage.name: AssetLimitProps
documentation: asset extend limit properties, set asset "can do", example, `CanTransfer`, `CanDestroyWithdrawal`
notice if not set AssetLimit, default is true for this limit
if want let limit make sense, must set false for the limit

documentation: asset balance for user&token, use btree_map to accept different asset type

storage.name: TotalAssetBalance

documentation: memo len

calls.name: register_asset

calls.name: revoke_asset

calls.name: set_balance

calls.name: transfer

events.name: Change
documentation: change token balance, SignedBalance mark Positive or Negative

storage.name: ApplicationMHeader
documentation: linked node header

storage.name: ApplicationMTail

storage.name: ApplicationMap
documentation: withdrawal applications collection, use serial number to mark them, and has prev and next to link them

storage.name: SerialNumber
documentation: withdrawal application serial number

storage.name: ValidatorCount
documentation: The ideal number of staking participants.

storage.name: MinimumValidatorCount
documentation: Minimum number of staking participants before emergency conditions are imposed.

storage.name: MinimumCandidateThreshold
documentation: Minimum value (self_bonded, total_bonded) to be a candidate of validator election.

storage.name: SessionsPerEra
documentation: The length of a staking era in sessions.

storage.name: BondingDuration
documentation: The length of the bonding duration in blocks.

storage.name: IntentionBondingDuration
documentation: The length of the bonding duration in blocks for intention.

storage.name: MaximumIntentionCount
documentation: Maximum number of intentions.

storage.name: CurrentEra
documentation: The current era index.

storage.name: DistributionRatio
documentation: Allocation ratio of native asset and cross-chain assets.

storage.name: NextSessionsPerEra
documentation: The next value of sessions per era.

storage.name: LastEraLengthChange
documentation: The session index at which the era length last changed.

storage.name: ForcingNewEra
documentation: We are forcing a new era.

storage.name: Intentions
documentation: All the accounts with a desire to be a validator.

storage.name: IntentionsV1
documentation: This is same with Intentions with the weight field extended from u64 to u128. Ref intention_profs! comments.

storage.name: NominationRecordsV1
documentation: This is same with NominationRecords with the weight field extended from u64 to u128. Ref intention_profs! comments.

storage.name: UpperBoundFactor
documentation: The upper bound nominations of the intention that could absorb is up to the self-bonded.

storage.name: EvilValidatorsPerSession
documentation: Reported validators that did evil, reset per session.

storage.name: LastRenominationOf
documentation: The height of user's last nomination.

storage.name: MaxUnbondEntriesPerIntention
documentation: The maximum ongoing unbond entries simultaneously against per intention.

storage.name: MinimumPenalty
documentation: Minimum penalty for each slash.

storage.name: OfflineValidatorsPerSession
documentation: The active validators that have ever been offline per session.

storage.name: MissedOfPerSession
documentation: Total blocks that each active validator missed in the current session.

storage.name: MissedBlockSeverity
documentation: The higher the severity, the more slash for missed blocks.

calls.name: unfreeze

calls.name: refresh

calls.name: register

calls.name: set_sessions_per_era

calls.name: set_bonding_duration

calls.name: set_validator_count

calls.name: set_maximum_intention_count

storage.name: PriceVolatility

do not need to remove after this tx is removed from ChainX

storage.name: GenesisInfo

calls.name: claim
documentation: Make a claim.

events.name: Claimed
documentation: Someone claimed some DOTs.

documentation: trustee basal info config

events.name: EthereumBinding

documentation: If the validator has been reported the double sign misbehavior at a certain height.

storage.name: Fishermen

calls.name: report_double_signer
documentation: Report the double sign misbehavior by fisherman.
the header is tuple of (pre_header(Vec<u8>), signature(64Bytes), slot(u64))

calls.name: register_fisherman
documentation: Add a new fisherman.

calls.name: remove_fisherman
documentation: Remove a fisherman.

storage.name: LockedUpBTC
documentation: locked up btc is UTXO, using (txid, out_index) to represent it
use UTXO => (accountid, balance)

storage.name: AddressLockedCoin
documentation: sum value for single Bitcoin addr

storage.name: LockedCoinLimit
documentation: single addr and ont output limit coin value, default limit is 0.01 BTC ~ 10 BTC

calls.name: push_transaction
documentation: if use `LockupRelayTx` struct would export in metadata, cause complex in front-end

events.name: Lock
documentation: accountid, value, txid, txoutput_index, output_btc_addr

events.name: Unlock
documentation: txid, input_index, input_outpoint_hash, input_outpoint_index

events.name: UnlockedFromRoot
documentation: use root to unlock UTXO

storage.name: GasSpent
documentation: Gas spent so far in this block.

storage.name: CurrentSchedule
documentation: Current cost schedule for contracts.

storage.name: PristineCode
documentation: A mapping from an original code hash to the original code, untouched by instrumentation.

storage.name: CodeStorage
documentation: A mapping between an original code hash and instrumented wasm code, ready for execution.

storage.name: AccountCounter
documentation: The subtrie counter.

storage.name: ContractInfoOf
documentation: The code associated with a given account.

storage.name: GasPrice
documentation: The price of one unit of gas.

calls.name: update_schedule
documentation: Updates the schedule for metering contracts.
The schedule must have a greater version than the stored schedule.

calls.name: put_code
documentation: Stores the given binary Wasm code into the chain's storage and returns its `codehash`.
You can instantiate contracts only with stored code.

calls.name: call
documentation: Makes a call to an account, optionally transferring some balance.
* If the account is a smart-contract account, the associated code will be
executed and any value will be transferred.
* If the account is a regular account, any value will be transferred.
* If no account exists and the call value is not less than `existential_deposit`,
a regular account will be created and any value will be transferred.

calls.name: instantiate
documentation: Instantiates a new contract from the `codehash` generated by `put_code`, optionally transferring some balance.
Instantiation is executed as follows:
- The destination address is computed based on the sender and hash of the code.
- The smart-contract account is created at the computed address.
- The `ctor_code` is executed in the context of the newly-created account. Buffer returned
after the execution is saved as the `code` of the account. That code will be invoked
upon any call received by this account.
- The contract is initialized.

calls.name: claim_surcharge
documentation: Allows block producers to claim a small reward for evicting a contract. If a block producer
fails to do so, a regular users will be allowed to claim the reward.
If contract is not evicted as a result of this call, no actions are taken and
the sender is not eligible for the reward.

events.name: Transfer
documentation: Transfer happened `from` to `to` with given `value` as part of a `call` or `instantiate`.

events.name: Instantiated
documentation: Contract deployed by address at the specified address.

events.name: CodeStored
documentation: Code with the specified hash has been stored.

events.name: ScheduleUpdated
documentation: Triggered when the current schedule is updated.

events.name: Dispatched
documentation: A call was dispatched from the given account. The bool signals whether it was
successful execution or not.

events.name: Contract
documentation: An event from contract of account.
